text: I didnt realize it at first- but they are using a  vidyard plugin that is converting all the videos to vidyard format automatically. If I toggle off the sharing settings after uploading the video then I can just use the normal URL and I dont have to go searching for the hidden vidyard URL.

Hi All! I think I have an easy question. I have a hubdb that is joined to another hubdb via the foreign_id option. In a custom module, I am pulling all the items from the fist Hubdb, and I want to build a select field that will operate as a quick filter pulling only the unique values from that foreign_id field. What is the correct Hubdb call to get only the unique values from that foreign_id column?
Can u describe your use case with some examples?
Via HubL, you will get access to the  selected foreign table rows and you need to iterate the rows and get the unique values of the column you are interested..

Hi Gobi, thanks for the response. That is exactly what I want to do, grab the unique values out of that column. The original Hubdb is going to be a list of items that the client can add to a page and filter based on the ‘contains’ parameter, so they only show what items from that hubdb that they want. I want to look at those items, and build a small select field with the unique values in that foreign_id column to make a quick / simple js filter of those items from the original Hubdb.
I have a super basic prototype in my portal if you want to take a look. It can be tom as well, no hurry as i know its late in the day
